Atmosphere is a little dark in the evening for my tastes, but during the day the plentiful windows let in lots of light.

Seven Saints is one of my favorite restaurants in the Champaign area. It's great quality food, especially for the price. The menu is also very creative. I have never been to a restaurant with it's own slider menu. And there's SO many great slider options. Some of my favorites include the California Turkey and BBQ slider.   Additionally, the service is always on point. The waiters are so polite and fast. My water is always filled and my requests are met right away.   The atmosphere is nice as well. It's dark, cozy, and comfortable but still feels more upscale than most places in Champaign. I would highly recommend Seven Saints to anyone looking for great food in the area.

I give it a three stars because the food tasted just okay and the service was slow. What we ordered was a tonic water and a IPA beer, one appetizer, and four sliders and a salad. We had two different servers and we stated we were hungry. And, what we got came in the following order: (1) a fast tonic water, and then, (2) a slow and not so generous portion of sweet potato fries; and then, (3) an even slower set of four different sliders, and (4) salad and then (5) my IPA beer.  Regarding the food, the salmon slider had a significant kick to it - I recommend it. But, there was no kick to the bratwurst with sauerkraut; the sauerkraut was bland and Dijon?  Also, the turkey slider had flavorless red peppers and would have benefited from larger slice of avocado or mashed avocado given the portion size. The others were not so worth mentioning.   Waiting for my beer and food seemed silly given that it seemed like a slow Tuesday night. This place earned its three because the salmon slider and fries were good and the beer list looked great. Maybe we just ordered wrong and had the wrong servers?

Used to frequent this place, but the last few times I have been here, the food has been awful.  The bar is decent... but with all of those bottles, one would think the drink menu would be more expansive.  Best time to go is when you can sit outside.  However, that is less than a 3 month window... and outside of it, the ambiance is as cold as the weather.   Great location.  Make better use of it.

Gone down hill. I used to love their sliders and salads, but the service here is atrocious. The latest time I tried to go, we sat down and proceeded to be ignored for 30 minutes even as the servers saw us. Finally someone said they would get to us, but 10 minutes later, we just left. Oh, and this was a Monday night. It's worse on weekends.

Probably my favorite place to go to get some well-priced and delicious food on a night out. It's also the place I recommend when people from out of town ask where they should go for dinner. The service there is very friendly and prompt, and the food is good. I've never had the salmon burgers, but I wouldn't expect the fish dishes to be the best in the heart of Central Illinois anyway. The Buffalo Chicken Slider and Classic Slider with Cheese are my favorites, along with a side of waffle fries (although if you're a fan of sweet potato fries, they have the best in town). The chipotle ranch sauce that comes with the onion rings is amazing, the tomato bisque is absolutely out of this world and they have a great selection of whiskey and beer at the bar. I really think of this place as more of a restaurant than a bar though. They tend to get busy on Friday and Saturday nights, and if the wait is long, make sure you're back earlier than you think if you decide to walk around the area.   Definitely one of the gems in Champaign-Urbana and a place that I would recommend to anyone looking for a good meal at a decent price.

Vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free options available, although few. Just above-par bar food good enough for a stop-in now and then if you're out for adult beverages.  Vegetarians should ask if there is egg in the buns used for the portabella burger.  Vegans are limited to salads minus cheese. And watch out for the dressings. Make sure you ask which ones are dairy-free.  Gluten-free folks be wary of the fries. I tried the sweet potato fries and I was fine afterward, but every gluten-free tummy is different and this place does not guarantee g/f fried foods. Also, if you are gluten-free and vegetarian going for the Boca Burger, remember that Boca uses wheat gluten in their burgers. They are not gluten-free.  The hummus was great, but it's served with pita bread, so that is a no-go for gluten-free folks. Maybe if I try this dish again I will ask for vegetable slices instead of pita bread. I'm not sure if they'll do it, but it can't hurt to ask.  My husband ordered two beers. One was warm, and the other tasted like dirty armpit. He was not a fan.  I had two glasses of Pinot Noir and they were fine. But for $9 a glass I want a wine that surpasses "fine."  My husband and I each ordered a different salad, and both of us were unimpressed but not quite disappointed.  Apparently if you love bourbon this is the place to be. They have a huge selection.  The ambience is cleanly dim and almost classy. The staff is friendly. I will probably end up here again, and that will be just fine.

One of my favorite places in champaign to eat at. I love the theme/decor of the whole restaurant! It is pretty intimate and has low lighting with huge gothic drapes..and good music is always playing. The food is amazing too. No matter what you order, you will be pleasantly surprised! The menu is very diverse/unique (good for picky eaters). I love the crab cake, salmon, and black and blue salads! The sliders and waffle fries are always great too. Im never disappointed! And the prices is very reasonable as well. They have pick two/three deals. Comparable to an an a lot more upscale/trendy panera!  They are open until 2 am, kitchen closes at 12 I believe, so its great for late nights. Love this place

The sliders here are good...just a bit on the pricey side.  I had the buffalo chicken and it was awesome!  Then i had 1/2 a goat cheese salad which was also very good.   I ordered the cheese curds as an appetizer and that was a big mistake... The portion is huge.... They're the size of donut holes (like those ones you get at dunkin donuts) and you get like 12 of them in an order.  I was full after two.... I'm used to cheese curds being the size of popcorn....not golf balls.  And the breading on them is very heavy.  Other than that, i enjoyed the slider/salad combo.
The buffalo chicken slider is my go to, always love this one.  The soups can also be good.  The largest whisky selection in the downstate area by a mile.

The food was okay, but the service was severely lacking. On their menu, they have combos that are more expensive than buying the components separately. When I asked the waitress to order them separately, she seemed repulsed and upset that I was trying to cheat the system. My friend that I was here with also tried doing the same thing. Later she stopped by and said that the combo prices included tax so while I saved money my friend spent more. It was great to find out the reason the combo prices appeared more expensive on the menu, but the next thing the waitress did was unprofessional: she made a snark remark that my friend's higher price was our punishment for trying to pay less. Don't get me wrong, I still tipped 20% because I'm not a selfish man but that doesn't mean I am willing to throw my money away when there's something cheaper. I don't think I will be coming here again unless someone insists.

Cheese Curd Heaven at "Gourmet White Castle!"  Slide on over to Seven Saints, a trendy, burger bar specializing in sliders in Champaign, IL. It offers house-made, hand-pattied beef sliders with a variety of gemlicious topping combos and complimentary lettuce, tomatoes, pickles & onions upon request. If beef isn't your baby, don't fret, there are plenty of other protein options or try em all: hand-made, seasoned turkey patty, salmon, bratwurst, hotdog, blt, grilled chicken, fried chicken patty, and boca burgers are also available as slider options.   Also, Seven Saints has a gemload of yummy salads, sides and apps. You can order things a la carte, or they offer mix & match combo platters (e.g. choose a slider, 1/2 salad & a side, the "Triple S Combo" for $9.79 or choose a slider & a 1/2 salad for $7.99, etc.). I got the original turkey slider with lettuce, tomato & pickle & a 1/2 order of the Greek salad. As an app, I ordered the cheese curds, and on a subsequent visit I got a side order of sweet potato fries.   For starters, the cheese curds here are the best ones I've ever had! They are made in-house, lightly beer-battered & are like giant marshmallows stuffed with gooey, white cheddar cheese. They will cost you $8.49 out of pocket & set you back about 2 weeks worth of calories & cholesterol, but they alone are worth the road trip to Champaign!  My turkey burger slider was a little larger than a silver dollar. It was nothing extraordinary but was fresh, not greasy & pretty tasty, a solid 4 stars. The mini bun was nice & soft too.   I also got the half order of the Greek salad which is field greens tossed in a traditional Greek vinaigrette with cucumbers, kalmata olives, red onions, pepperoncinis, fire-roasted artichokes & is topped with feta cheese. It was really flavorful, fresh & tasty, and I would re-order it!   I don't order sweet potato fries that often but ordered them here because they were crinkle-cut which I rarely see. I'm glad I did because they were some of the best SPF I've ever had. At some places, the customary straight ones are either limp/soggy with no crispiness or overly sweet with some unwelcome/unwanted surprise, sugary-coating basted all over them. These guys were soft on the inside with a perfect, crispiness on the outside (kind of like White Castle's regular fries), and they weren't doused in any surprise, sugary-coating. They had a nice, natural sweet potato taste, 5 gems for taste & texture!   Last thing, this bar is well-stocked for the most part. It has a gemload of liquor & craft beers. I tried Rain Organic Vodka on the rocks with regular olives for the first time. I didn't really care for it because it's a lil harsh with a sweet after taste. If I ever come back, I will just stick to Chopin Vodka, since they didn't have Ciroc Vodka, my fave (boo).   All in all, my experience at Seven Saints was pretty heavenly. The service here is decent but needs a slight tune up. The bartenders were friendly but service was a lil slow & scattered for my taste (however not Denny's-Champaign, IL slow, thank heavens!), almost a 4 though. The cheese curds & sweet potato fries were the saints of the show, and I do like all of the various slider & salad options on the menu. (Think gourmet White Castle with salads & booze too!)  It's dark & nice inside, and they are striving for a Wicker Park-like, Chicago bar feel. So if you ever find yourself in Champaign, IL, I recommend dining & drinking at this gemlicious, slider-burger bar as it was one of my fave places I visited in Champaign, a solid, high 4 gems!

This place is "known" for their sliders and I was impressed with the fact that they offered a vegetarian boca burger patty as a substitute for all their burgers. I really liked the atmosphere of the bar. It was a great place to watch the game I think next time but will just go for drinks since I didn't think the food was so great. I ordered the salmon slider and the salmon was so salty it was inedible. The other slider I ordered was okay nothing to rave about but the worst was the California turkey burger my friend ordered. The menu said it had avocado on it which it did but it was such a minuscule amount we literally cracked up about it. Its a clean bar and quiet enough to watch a game AND still hear the commentary but you might want to eat before you get there though.
We waited 15 minutes for waitress to return to take our order. The sliders were greasy and bacon was undercooked. Was once our favorite, sadly no longer.

The interior is nice looking and dimly lit, and Whiskey Wednesday is a fun gimmick but the food...is meh. If you order sliders they just come out on a giant white plate and it sort of detracts from the food. I'm serious--it's a big plate without even so much as a green piece of garnish and the sliders are just okay anyway. The service is average though servers can seem scarce because it's always so dang busy.
Nice ambience ... Good food .. Reasonably priced

Seven Saints has consistently good food and good service.  It's not a gastropub or Michelin-star restaurant.  Rather it's a solid local hangout that always delivers.  We had crab cakes, the Salmon Salad and the BLT.  All three were very tasty and affordable.  Had not been here for a few years, glad to see they are not only still around but that they remain on top of their game.  Service        B Parking       C Cleanliness B Restrooms  B Host Staff    B Lighting       A Noise          B Food           A Drinks         B

Went in tonight for a bite and drinks with two of my friends and were seated right away. After 15 minutes went by and we hadn't been greeted or acknowledged by serve staff yet the table behind us had been visited twice for drink refills, we decided to take off for another restaurant that would actually appreciate our business. On our way out, two servers setting in the front wrapping silverware made it obvious that side work and getting out at the end of their shift was their priority. Don't think I'll ever come back to give another shot, menu and beer selection were small and unimpressive anyway.

This is one of my favorite local restaurants in CU. First of all, the atmosphere is really amazing. A lot of care was taken to make the inside of this place something special. It has a slightly dark, gothic feel yet it still feels very cozy and inviting. I do wish the space was a bit bigger, however, as it can get busy very quickly and you'll run out of places to sit.  Service-wise I've almost always had great service. The wait-staff is friendly and the bartenders are fast and responsive. They have a nice selection of spirits. The best part has to be the food, though. They have a nice selection of salads. My absolute favorite is the Seven Saints Salad. I've never tasted anything quite like it. It has a crisp bed of greens topped with tiny hot green peppers and a VERY generous portion of pieces of steak. The steak is flavorful and moist and the whole salad has a clear dressing that compliments the other components perfectly. The best part is that you can have the salad as part of a special served with a couple of their sliders for around $8. It's a great deal.  Speaking of their sliders, they have a really wonderful selection of mini-hamburgers. They aren't as heavily greasy as you might expect from a traditional slider. My favorites are probably the Asian slider with it's wasabi spread, the Buffalo Chicken slider (with an amazing sauce on a crispy piece of chicken and served with ranch dip) and the Blacjack burger. There are a ton more and pretty much anything to suit your taste.  Another standout aspect of Seven Saints are their appetizers. If I have one complaint it's that they seem incapable of keeping their Beet Chips ready to order. Out of the five times I've tried to order them, I've only ever been able to get them twice. I don't know if I've just had bad timing or what but I do wish they were a bit more diligent with those. If you do manage to order them they are delicious and are served with a yummy goat cheese dip. If they are out of them, there are still a lot of great options. You can't go wrong with either of their mushroom appetizers.

Loved the style and ambiance of the place. Very laid back, but classy as well. The waiter was so nice and answered any and all questions I had about the very, very large liquor menu. My husband and I got the 1/2 salad 1/2 soup option which is a very nice price! The vegetable soup was very hardy and our salads were delicious. Would definitely go back if I lived nearby.

The ambiance probably beats the food. The steak salad. Warning, it might not be edible. Last time I tried it, it tasted like the sea. Salt city. Same could be said for the salmon sliders. Aside from this unpleasant surprise, everything else on the menu tasted pretty good. The alcohol selection, service, and vibe of the place were perfectly lovely, however. Food, less so...

One of my favorite places to eat in Champaign. Cheese curds are a must when you eat here, and their tomato bisque soup is delicious as well. Sliders are great too! They always have a great selection of seasonal drafts as well.   Definitely a place to check out in the CU area.  Can get crowded on the weekends and it is a smaller restaurant, if it isn't nice outside you will be cramped with the others waiting for a table at the bar.

I've been back with friends twice after the server and manager argued that we were not waiting for the 20 minutes we had been. Both times we received unfriendly and inattentive service. I figured my first visit was an anomaly and found out from those that I visited with that the service is consistently bad.   The food: the cheese curds are okay. I'm not sure why everyone thinks they are so incredible? Maybe the massive size? The sliders are pretty good, but I don't think the quality warrants the price. I had the black and blue salad and it was a huge portion for a half size which was awesome! But the taste was not there. It was pretty awful. I couldn't eat it and just enjoyed my baby sized burger instead.   The best time to come would probably be Whiskey Wednesday. Come drunk and get drunker and the terrible food and service won't be an issue.
If the server wouldn't of been so snotty I would of loved it more. Food was great. Booze was top shelf.  Come on a night where they r putting on a talk!!

My biggest disappointment probably stems from how much my friends talked this place up, and the service & food quality falling so very short of expectations.    Regardless of "how" or "why", the food was sub-par, especially for the price, and the service was what we've all come to expect from fast food employees.  Won't be going back.

This is one of my all time favorite places in town. Whenever going out to eat with friends, this is literally the first thing I suggest each time if that puts anything into perspective.   They are known for their awesome sliders. An entire page of their menu is dedicated to these little guys and they come in a huge variety of flavors/meats/etc. My personal favorite thing I eat there is the Seven Saints salad. I always substitute the sirloin for salmon and it's to die for. They are always so accommodating and will help you adjust your order however you need it to be.  Great service, ambiance, and cuisine. Need I say more?

Ate here on Saturday, March 15th, 2014.  Yow.  We ordered our drinks, and they came out quick.  We followed that with an order of cheese curds which were pretty good overall.  From there, it was sliders and salad or sides.  I ordered the Jack slider, and it was pretty darn good.  The food came out fairly fast, and the prices didn't break the bank.  One weird thing - employees wore numbers instead of names.  I had visions of "The Prisoner" flash through my head "I will not be pushed, filed, stamped, indexed, briefed, debriefed or numbered - my life is my own."    The restrooms were clean.  All in all, a good visit.
Great service! Food was awesome and filling. I think we'll be making a trip back before we leave town

came here for a friend's birthday recently.  the food was alright, just a bit too greasy and unoriginal.  as another dining companion put it, they have good ideas but the execution was off.  the drink i ordered, "the maple leaf" with canadian whiskey, lemon and maple syrup was a bit too sweet, i had to thin it out with water.  i'll most certainly be back...but seven saints was certainly nothing to "write home about."

Amazing selection of whiskey which automatically earns it 5 stars in my book! They also carry a good selection of beers, they also have the left hand milk stout which is one of my favorite beers ever. Food is absolutely amazing as well, great place for late night drinks and snacks. Can't go wrong with the pretzels!

Our U of I freshman son suggested coming here for a late lunch as we were returning from FL on our way home to the Chicago suburbs. What a fun surprise this place was! The decor was rich and inviting on a cold snowy April Fools Day. Each of us had different sliders (the salmon one was delicious) and assorted sides and salads. The Black & Bleu salad had big pieces of tender, flavorful steak sprinkled with blue cheese, meaty mushrooms and sautéed onions. It was beyond my expectations in size and taste. Service was attentive, but not intrusive. I can't wait to go back!

The sliders are good, and they have decent selection of draft beers (including Rogue Dead Guy!).  The asian slider is average, because the wasabi mayo could have used a little more of the wasabi.  The smokey bacon cheese slider was awesome for a person who likes to be kicked in the teeth with flavor:  crispy bacon, smokey BBQ sauce, smoked cheddar.  My wife ordered the coup de grace: the tropical slider with grilled pineapple and thai peanut sauce.  Since you might order 2 or 3 sliders anyway, this one is well worth trying!

Sat at the bar, Figgy was my bartender, very knowledgeable on his spirits and craft cocktails.  Made a mean old fashioned, which I can appreciate.  Service was great and food was pretty good.  Definitely be back!
The BLT salad is wonderful and the salmon sliders rock. The tomato bisque is really wonderful.
My favorite place for: Whiskey Wednesday,  giant cheese curds, and tomato bisque soup.

7 Saints has a pious name and heavenly grub.  I love their mixing and matching with their 3 S combos.  I typically get a slider, salad, and soup for slightly over 10 bucks.  I encourage you to trust your instincts on which ones to choose, as I have not met one that I did not like.  I usually eat all the food, b/c I'm American.  I leave sufficiently full, but don't hate myself so I'd say it's just right :)  This place does not take reservations and I've waited for up to an hour before.  Therefore, it may not be the best place to hit up during prime time hours if you have plans afterwards.

This restaurant has an amazing menu! There is something for everyone. The sliders are great, the salads are great, the soups are great! My favorite item on the menu is the cheese curds appetizer. They also have a diverse beer selection.

I'm from California here in Champaign on business and gave this place a try. The sliders were delicious and full of flavor (had the BBQ one and one with pineapple) and they had a great selection of beer. I'll give it try again tomorrow for some of the sliders.

I love the ambiance and decor more than the food. The food is good, however it's a pretty straight forward menu: soups, salads, sandwiches/sliders. I only want that every so often. Great place to get drinks and a couple appetizers in the main room. It's dark and plush and lighting is great.

We always, always stop here when we are in town. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal at Seven Saints.  Firstly, there's an expansive beer and whiskey list. In terms of appetizers--we are hardly ever people who order starters, but we usually do here. Fried mushrooms, cheese curds, onion rings--they're all good and don't make you feel gross afterwards like some other places do.  The salads are big and hearty. Sliders offer lots of options. And their menu allows you to mix and match things to meet your taste. Personally I like the red pepper gouda soup when they have it and the southwest chipotle chicken salad.   The wait staff is friendly, but not what I'd call amazing. The vibe inside feels warm and plush. Overall, if this place was in my neighborhood, I'd be a regular.

Good bar and restraint concept.  Lots of craft beer selections, specialty drinks and good wines by the glass.  The menu was perfect for me. Smaller portions - Seven Saints specializes in sliders and there must have been 20 choices - burgers, salmon, bacon, BBQ, vegetarian, etc.  I did a mix and match with sliders, soup of the day and a salad.  Our server, Grant, was informative and helpful, while being witty and funny. Sometimes a waiter makes the meal memorable and Grant certainly made our night seem special.  The place does not take reservations, and it can get busy.  Worth the wait.  Parking nearby can be problematic, but then again the bar and food overcome that minor detail.
Food and drinks here are amazing. Ambience is cool and romantic. People are nice what more can you ask for

I have eaten here a few times and never been overly impressed with this place. Last night, I ate here and ordered the Tomato and Pesto grilled cheese.  Huge mistake.  My grilled cheese came out with one slice of hard, dried to the bread, cheese on two huge pieces of Texas toast.  It was so dry I had to ask for marinara sauce to dip it in just to choke it down.  So not worth it- flavorless and disgusting.  Kinda like how I feel about everything else I have ordered there.  OK for drinks, but avoid the food. Oh, and don't bother complaining to the GM, Andy.  He could care less. Way to keep customers.

When at U of I, we invariably end up at Seven Saints.  We might have wanted to go somewhere else, but some weekends are so hard to get a table at the local restaurants.  Seven Saints always seems to be able to accommodate, and although I never think the service is spectacular, I can overlook that for the great burgers, pub atmosphere and drink selection.  I'll be back......

Still one of my favorite bars, which is funny, because I've never had a drink here! I just come for the food (sliders and salads here are great) and atmosphere. I took my parents here for lunch, too. I'd say skip this place for lunch. Portions are kind of small for the price if you want an actual meal. Great light fare though. Plus, it's way prettier at night.  ---  Finally tried some cocktails here... they were not well made. No flavor, no bite, everything tasted like sugar water. I tried the portobello sandwich with fruit. Fruit was ... I didn't understand it. Everything, the food ... all of it... was so poor. Way too expensive for an awful and basic, bland meal.

I really enjoy going to Seven Saints when I'm in town. They've got a crazy selection of alcohol and at quite reasonable prices (at least the gin). The sliders are quite tasty. I had the salmon one which was definitely good and I also got the BBQ, which was as good as I had it on my previous visit. I believe on my first visit I also got the one with the pineapple and that was kinda wacky but still really tasty!

I'm just so-so about the food, but I just saw someone else had fried cheese curds there.  I'll have to try those yet.  Hard liquor selection is just f-ing amazing!!!!   Sooooo worth the visit.  The liquor they carry alone is worth the 5 stars.

I enjoy going to Seven Saints when other bars can be so crowded, especially on the weekends. The service is usually (but not always) friendly, with a good wine and beer selection. The food can be pretty "meh." I've tried their appetizers, salads, sliders, and desserts and nothing has blown me away. What really wins me over is how chill it usually is in there, and the layout, furniture, atmosphere of the interior. I recommend it, especially if you're not interested in a crazy night on the town.

Great little place in Champaign.  I've eaten here twice when driving through the area.  Love the cheese curds, they are so huge.  I normally get the mix n match with a slider/salad and side.  More than enough food and good quality.  Nice atmosphere inside as well.

Had some sliders that were delicious as well as a couple drinks. Service wasn't too bad, and had a lot of workers hanging around the front and goofing off I guess. Server vanished for a bit at the end as well. The food was delicious though.

We were in town for a short event and went here for dinner. We all liked it so much we came back for lunch the next day.   The flavor combinations were interesting and delicious!  And the menu allows you to mix and match almost any assortment of salad, side, slider, sandwich and soup for VERY reasonable prices.  Between 6 people and 2 meals with almost everyone trying 2-3 items each time, no one was disappointed with their choices. If I lived in the area this would be a regular stop.

You know, I really wanted this to be a 5-star joint.  I love the ambiance of the corner bar, dark wood, and dimly lit interior and the extensive offerings of specialty vodkas, gins, and whiskeys.  The cheese curd appetizer was very good but not out of this world.  The beer batter was a little soft and I suspect the cheese had not been frozen prior to deep frying (or not completely), which resulted in most of the cheese over-melting and dripping out of the solidified batter shell.  Still tasty, but missing the mark a little bit.  The sliders were pretty good, but the BBQ had too much botte-tasting sauce on it.  The beef was cooked perfectly though.  Caesar salad was average at best.  On the plus side, they have a nice selection of draft and bottled beer.

I've eaten here several times and it has been a good experience. The sliders are great and keeps people coming back. I really enjoy the chili and any salad with the marinated sirloin. The have an endless list of drinks. If you're looking for fun place to go out check it out!

I came here for dinner with a friend who is currently in grad school at U of I and with another friend just passing through Chambana for few hours.  In short, we just needed a place to catch up and Seven Saints provided that and more!  On a Sunday evening, we were seated outside immediately and our waiter was accommodating and attentive without hovering.  We each ended up going with the slider and salad combo with sweet potato fries on the side.  I chose the salmon slider (complete with cucumber and dill sauce) and the salmon salad (a more Mexican take with a southwest ranch dressing) & I was extremely content with my choices; even having some leftovers for lunch the next day!  In my opinion, the portions were definitely very reasonable.  The sliders were about the size of the diameter of a standard water or beer glass or at least that is what our waiter told us! Seven Saints ended up being the perfect spot to catch up with old friends over some delicious food; I'd definitely recommend this joint to anyone with a rumbling tummy in downtown Chambana!

The sweet potato chips with goat cheese dip are phenomenal - perfect combo of sweet and salty.  Sliders are decent - left a little to be desired but overall good. Salads are fresh, tasty - really a lot of great options, nice atmosphere and extensive drink list.

a cool looking American pub with decent food but a small serving of fries with the meal. This is a classic college bar in this college town and pretty much the service was decent enough. The layout is great with outdoor seating in the warm months and there is plenty of cool seating and beers to choose form in a visit of this bar.

I love this place for one simple reason: its good drinks + good sliders + goos ambience all in one. Everything is just good enough, but it has all three! I would bring anyone from out of town here because palate wise, everyone is likely to find something here. Good date place too, and people are audible  despite the music playing in the background...which builds the ambience.

Love this place. We just moved back to Danville, IL and we can see ourselves traveling to Champaign just to partake in all the splendor of Seven Saints!  They specialize in sliders and oh my gosh they do them well. We ordered 3 to share. We shared the salmon slider, chicago style slider and a basic bacon cheeseburger. I'll start with the bacon cheeseburger. It was good.  I would describe it as very hardy and well seasoned. The salmon slider was awesome.  Very fresh. Loved the dill sauce and the cucumber was crispy and perfect. Ok so now my favorite...the Chicago style hotdog. The sliced the whole hotdog so it would fit on the bun. They added all of the usual suspects, bright green relish, pickles, hot pepper and tomato AND the nicest surprise...poppy seeds on the normal (yet tasty) slider bun. Not sure how much or for how long you can savor a slider, but I tried. Mmmm. We sat at the bar and conversed with the friendly bartender, figgy. He was so nice and great about making recommendations. They feature some great craft beers. We enjoyed two different ones by the local brewery (Savoy, IL) Triptych. Husband ordered the IPA and I had the red ale. Perfect combination with the sliders we chose. All in all this was a great find for us.
Cheese curds taste so good here. Many choices for sliders and they taste good too. Nice environment and the server was very nice and friendly. Great place!

My first visit to Seven Saints got off to a slow start. We asked to be seated outdoors,the weather was nice and their curbside tables are nice. Well we sat for 20 min and no waitress. There were three outside but no one stopped at our table. I finally stopped the young man at the front door and he quickly found us someone to take our order. Hey everybody has an off night!  My husband and I enjoy not the run of the mill beers and we were surprised to find extensive selection at seven saints. Goose island 312 for me and fat tire for my spouse. We started our dinner off with fried cheese curds. The cheese curds were golden brown and not greasy,they come highly recommended! We each ordered 2 sliders and a side of waffle fries. I had Asian and smoked BBQ slider and Doug ordered BBQ and California turkey slider. All were cooked to perfection and delicious . They have several options when it comes to the menu so I feel there is something for everyone. All in all we had a wonderful dining experience and our waitress( once we got one) was on the ball and friendly. We will be returning and I would recommend Seven Saints to our friends.

When I first tried this place out I was like, "yea it's ok" but then I went back three different times with 3 different friends who all love it. One. Cheese Curds, don't tell your weight watcher leader, but order them and thank me later. The black and blue salad was OUT OF THIS WORLD good! Yum! The speciality drinks of the night have never failed me. Good! I even like mine a little sweeter, so I told my waitress and she just had them add a little simple syrup to my liking. :) There's that excellent service for you! I'm now officially a big fan!

Ribeye special tonight -- it's partially on me for ordering it at a pub -- the steak was more like a medium well sirloin (lean, tough) instead of a medium ribeye. Good flavor, just not the best cut of meat. Had a great stout on draft, Camp Waconda, but the Old Fashioned erred too much on the side of muddled orange and not enough on bourbon and bitters for my palate. Would give it another try but I'd certainly order a pint and a cheaper menu item.

Everyone knows this place is known for their sliders, and they are certainly worth a try.  I liked them enough to go back a few times while living in the area, and always had a good service and good food.  Never tried anything outside of the sliders.

This review is brought to you by the letter S.   S: liders galore offered here! There's a whole page of them on the menu. I tried the one with fried jalapeños on it and didn't have a problem polishing it off.  S: alads are another 's' that this place serves up. Must be atleast 12 different choices.  S: alty was my Seven Saints salad bc of the seasoning on the beef. It also came with cashews.  S: atisfied by my combo entree of a slider, 1/2 salad, and choice of side.  S: ervice was friendly on the outside patio.
Great atmosphere, parking can be challenging but worth the walk.  Full bar with great service...Never had a bad meal here.  Nice place for a date or a night out with a few friends.  Strong Recommend.

I enjoyed a quick lunch at Seven Saints with a lovely friend on a sunny afternoon. We opted to sit outside and were immediately given a table. We ordered the cheese curds for an appetizer, and I had a grilled chicken slider with the goat cheese salad. I absolutely recommend the cheese curds - they were my favorite part of the meal. The slider was a little dry for me, but the salad was very good!   Our server was very friendly and quick, and the location is perfect if you work near downtown Champaign. From what I saw inside the restaurant, it looked like a pretty calm atmosphere. Outside seating is very good!   Overall, if you're looking for a lunch place, Seven Saints is a great choice. They offer a wide variety of options to fit almost anyone's palate!

Whiskey Wednesday is a great time to come! Many people love their sliders but I think they are just OK. My favorite is the sweet chips. Sweet potato chips with a goat cheese dip. Great place to hang out, nice atmosphere, good drinks, and tasty food.
Love their sliders and soups. I always go for the soup of the day -always a good deal. Oh and did I mention their seven sinners platter?

Almost everything here is a la carte but there are pick-2 and pick-3 combos. The Black Jack Slider is consistently good. The Classic Slider was nothing special. Even though I lurve a good tomato bisque, this one didn't stand out.The beer is good though there seem to be only a handful on tap. I feel the prices are a little high to pay for average food.  The atmosphere is dark and intimate because of the booth seating; but it is loud and often busy so the service is so-so. There is also outdoor seating but it is right on a downtown street so it can be busy. Bike parking is also right there in front so while it is convenient for cyclists, it can get in the way of the outdoor seating. For autos, there's metered street parking and a pay-to-park lot across the street.
We stopped in for a night cap before taking the train and our waitress Hannah was absolutely awesome!  She went above and beyond to accommodate us!  Thanks Hannah!
Good food. Good service. Good location. Friendly atmosphere. Sliders to die for. Great drink selection. Drunk pecan pie with ice cream to die for again.

The Boy and I came here because we saw a Capital Brewery sign floating in the window like a neon beacon of hope and happiness.  We sat at the bar and perused the beer list.  Sadly, the only Capital beer they had came in the form of cans of the Island Wheat.  Ew, and oh no.  Fortunately, the rest of the beer list was fairly extensive and diverse.  But what's this?  Cheese curds?!  Oh, Seven Saints.  You have cut to the core of this simple Wisconsin girl.   So, we ordered the cheese curds, a Rogue Dead Guy Ale and an Anchor Steam (solid beer choices, if you're in the market). The cheese curds were not cheese curds.....they were palm-sized balls of mozzarella with a light, gooey breading on them.  And they came with a delicious marinara sauce.  Let me tell you something: These 'curds' are not f'n around.  They are formidable.  We couldn't finish them, they were so heavy.  How is it that Illinois managed to out-fat bastard Wisconsin?  Go figure.    Seven Saints is a very pretty bar, at least at night.  All espresso-dark wood and nice lighting.  And the jukebox was interesting.  When we first got in there, the crowd all seemed slightly older....so it was very odd that some new hip hop/hump dancey song was bumping over the stereo.  Swiftly and even more randomly, the jukebox changed over to super hits of my early adolescence: Blind Melon, Spin Doctors, and even some Van Halen.  I was okay with this, if not a little more than amused.  When it comes right down to it, we all know I'm coming back.

Consistently has pretty good service. Their wine selection is somewhat wanting, but the beer and spirit menus are great. Pretty good pub food, more so if you're a meat eater, but definitely doable for vegetarians. It's always super clean, too.
We went here tonight for my birthday! Wonderful food and drinks and great service in a beautiful atmosphere!! We loved it and will be back again!

I wasn't expecting much from Seven Saints, yet somehow I still left disappointed.  There doesn't appear to be a beer menu, perhaps because they're really proud of their Jameson and Red Bull cocktails (ick) and would rather advertise those on your table.  This would be okay if they hadn't hidden the drafts behind columns such that it's impossible to discover what types of beer they have.  The food menu was more promising.  It's split into two parts:  half the items were ripped off from Crane Alley (beet chips with goat cheese, sweet potato fries, cajun crab cake) and the other half are "sliders".  Upscale White Castle.  Frankly, the food wasn't particularly bad.  My friend enjoyed his salad.  But it wasn't particularly good either:  his slider was only so-so and my sandwich was like a salt lick.  But I probably would have gone back just to break up the monotony of eating downtown if the service hadn't sucked.  When our waitress finally got around to us, I ordered a sandwich.  She came back five minutes later to tell me that there had been a "permanent substitution" with that item.  By substitution, she meant that it was nothing at all like the description - perhaps it still had the same kind of bread.  When I told her I didn't want this new sandwich, she made a big deal out of me being "too picky," and telling me that the kitchen was now going to be mad at her.  "Permanent substitution"?  Seriously, print new menus and lose the attitude.
Seven Saints is a fantastic establishment to eat. Friendly..clean...fast service and the food is wonderful. Not expensive and the menu is not complicated. Enjoy....

Really yummy! Hopped by before my Amtrak back to Chicago for a quick dinner (and I mean, quick, I only had an hour before the train left!)  Get the soup, salad, and slider combo. 3 meals in one for less than $10, and all the portions were extremely generous, you'd almost mistake this for diner and not pub/lounge prices!  The salad I chose was the salmon one, and the salmon piece was giant...much larger than I expected, and grilled to the perfect juiciness, not too dry and not too salty...pairing perfectly with the avocado (so so decadent). The slider was amazing...i thought it'd be too small but it's actually the same size as the Shake Shack chicken burgers (which is ridiculous imo), perfectly juicy, with cheese and bacon wedged in between a really large piece of beef O.o And of course the soup was great...not too creamy with bits of chicken...and I know this sounds bad, but it's like the cross of a panera bread and olive garden creamy corn and chicken soup (both of which I love).  Would love to try their other options, and I'll definitely have to see what those "whisky wednesdays" are that I've heard about!
I've come here two nights in a row and my friend and I got the different wine from the  selection they have and we loved everything we had. Breaded Green Beans and Black Jack Sliders are the best!

As usual great food, the downside of this visit was our server (#030). Through out our meal, she never stopped by to check-in. However we noticed she asked the table across from us as well as the tables on each side of us about their food and how things were going. We had to ask @ the soup options. I've counted at least 5 visits to the table across from us to the one where she took our order. Someone else brought us or food. It has seriously been 30 minutes since our waitress has stopped by. We had to stop another waitress for service. The roaming person with water provided better service than our server. I like Seven Saints and will be back, just hope I never have this server again. Not even a here you go and have a nice day when she brought us our checks. Seriously, not sure what went wrong here!!!

Every friend I have in the area just RAVES about this restaurant and its sliders, but i just dont see it. I have visited this restaurant twice now, both during the week and on the weekend, and have left feeling very less than satisfied.    The building itself is beautiful, the bar is stunning, the ambiance is lovely, (albeit incredibly loud- so dont go in there expecting to have a conversation with your dinner-mates), but the service is unimpressive.  There are certainly quite a few waiter/waitresses around (enough that i have watched them run into each other) but they never seem to come to my table.  Drinks take too long to be made as well as to reach my table from the bar.  I actually watched my drink sit at the waitress station at the bar with the ice melting in it for a while before it was brought to me.    I had the bavarian pretzels, which were decent by themselves, but the jalepeno sauce served with it was chunky and old, and had thickened to an almost inedible point.     As for the sliders, they were nothing special, and I thought, a bit over-priced for what they were.  I wasnt thrilled about the beef the burgers were made with, and it wasnt seasoned at all.   Absolutely avoid any slider with a Turkey Burger inside, it smelled old and.....stale? rancid?   The one shining point of my visits, and the only reason this place gets a second star is because of the cheese curds.  The breading was light and crisp, the cheese had substance, and best of all, they were even delicious re-heated the next day!  The sweet potato chips are also amazing.  I want to like this restaurant, but I just cant. This restaurant will never be my suggestion for a C-U dinner option.

All around amazing food. Big menu with lots of choices for everyone. My favorite starter is the sweet chips and I highly recommend them if you like both sweet potatoes ad goat cheese. It is a big portion so I suggest sharing, that goes with all their appetizers.  As far as for my meal I love getting the 1 slider 1/2 salad combo platter. My favorite salad is the goat cheese salad. It comes with fresh strawberries, grapes and candied walnuts with an amazing raspberry vinaigrette on the side. For the slider, I like to get the tropical stack, being vegetarian I opt for the boca burger and it tastes great. It comes with a warm grilled pineapple and delicious peanut sauce.  I've also heard great things about the grilled cheese with tomato bisque soup. I will have to try it next time I am there!

Came here last night about 8pm. The ambience is nice almost like a downtown Chicago feel and the food is good too. Notice I said good, cuz the $4 sliders I had were decent but not worth it. I tried a local Triptych Brewing beer called Blueberry Blonde that they had on tap & it was fairly warm but gud. All in all I had a mediocre experience but I will giv em another shot.

My wife and in went here about six months ago. The fact that we have not been back since then probably implies something.  We had some pretty darn good onion rings for an appetizer. My wife had a Tomato Pesto Grilled Cheese sandwich that we thought was pretty good, along with a nice Tomato Bisque. I had a trio of Sliders: Asian, Tropical Stack, and Salmon, served with Sweet Potatoe Fries.  I grew up in an area that had White Castle restaurants. Now, I never went there unless pressed, but I do know what a slider is.  The problem with these was not the taste, which was fine. Nor the size, which was small. The problem is that sliders are moist / greasy. Now, I'm not saying that having a non-greasy slider is a bad thing from a healthful eating perspective. But if you're going to call something a slider, there has to be something non-dry about it. sigh.  Service was friendly.  I would like to get back there and try some other items, but we always seem to think of someplace else we'd rather eat.

I love Seven Saints!  Everything, the food, the beers (good selection of bottle beers and there is always some special on the draft), the fantastic whisky selection (probably the best in town), the bartenders (always helpful and friendly, definitely worth a big fat tip!).  Tuesday the draft beers are half-price and Wednesday one type of whisky is half-price (I mean or Bourbon, or Scotch, or American... ok, u get the point).  You definitely need to try the sliders, they are what make the bar famous. Also, I really love the rib eye steak sandwich, its pricey ($10), but its amazing and it comes with a side (onion rings are killers in here).  There is also the possibility of ordering combos with salad, soup, etc... I never had that, but I heard its pretty good.  Bottom line: this place is a MUST in Champaign. During weekend it might get crowded and with a waiting line, usually I go by myself, so I never had that problem.

It's always a pleasant experience. So much so that we planned a visit based on our dining experience last year and stopped in twice over two days this time around.   The establishment is reasonably priced despite its swanky decor. My boyfriend say their Gibsons are some of the best he has tasted in a while and were equally as good even when prepared by two different bartenders. I wish there were more fruity cocktails but prefer to eat my calories over drinking them anyway.   We ordered:   Triple S combo (1/2 salad, slider and one side) - $9.79. I had the summer salmon salad, black jack slider and my beloved broccoli salad.  I absolutely loved all three and would order them again.  The salmon was marinated and very moist. Well done and accordingly to the server a better choice over the salmon slider.   Chili with cheese and onions - $4  Very hearty and perfect for a cool day paired well with a cold beer.
The staff is kind of rude and if you do not tell the staff not to burn the shit out of your hamburgers they will burn them to death

My husband and I ate here today for the first time.  The ambience and atmosphere is GREAT.  Beer selection, ditto.  Food was pretty good but I had the salmon slider and as some others have noted, it was too salty.  I also ordered it with lettuce and tomato (the waiter specifically asked me if I wanted any extras) but then it arrived with only the toppings listed in the menu.  7 Saints Salad was good, my husband's burger slider and Caeser Salad were good.  We enjoyed the hummus appetizer.  So overall a positive experience but not perfect.

I am torn over what to do with Seven Saints.  When I first went there I thought the food was great and the drinks were wonderful.  Over time, it has lost its luster.  What follows is my progression.  My first visit was mostly about the drinks.  I found the beer menu to be decent (which is what I felt like drinking that night).  I know I ordered food and I was not displeased with it.  Overall, my first experience was good and I came back for more.    My next visit included food and drinks.  I went with some sort of mixed drink that tasted fine but was not memorable.  I had the salmon slider to eat.  I did not notice if the menu listed what came with the slider or not, and the waitress did not bother to mention that the slider come with just the sandwich.  When I got my slider I realized that one mini sized salmon sandwich was not going to be enough for dinner.  Sadly, I started eating the slider before I ordered more food.  I can only describe it as a salty salmon puck.  After that, I was no longer hungry, and we went elsewhere.  I returned for lunch, and had the BLT salad with the tomato soup.  I recommend both options.  The soup was so good that I came back for lunch again and paired it with the tomato pesto grilled cheese.  This was also wonderful.  In fact it was so good that I found myself craving the soup and grilled cheese one day so I went for lunch.  Now, I am not a fan of swiss cheese which is one of the cheeses in the sandwich.  I requested that the swiss cheese be replaced with provolone instead.  When I got my sandwich there was no swiss cheese, but there was no other cheese on the sandwich.  There should have been American cheese as well.  I guess the server misunderstood my request, and I figured it was an honest mistake so I didn't think it was a big deal.  The last straw was yesterday.  I went for lunch again and ordered the tomato pesto grilled cheese with the tomato soup.  Again I requested that the swiss be replaced with provolone.  When I got my sandwich it was more like toast than a grilled cheese.  There was one slice of American cheese and one slice of provolone cheese on each piece of bread, but the cheese was not melty and gooey.  It was toasted and crispy.  Then the pesto was glopped on in one cold dollop.  I found the sandwich to be dry.   From now on I will probably only go to this place for the drinks.  Too bad I can find drinks at just about any bar in town.  I feel let down because I really wanted to like this place.  I love the look and feel of the bar, and it has all the potential to be great.  However, if they can't even accomplish a grilled cheese sandwich why would you want to eat their food?

Love the lively environment here and whiskey Wednesday makes me happy. The sliders are pretty good and the cheese curds really are great. But none of the food really stands out to me and some of the combos don't make any sense (sometimes cheaper to just buy each individually). Regardless, Seven Saints is definitely an enjoyable place downtown.

When you come here just order the salads, sliders, and soups. Really anything else isn't worth it. I ordered a steak sandwich medium and it was definitely well done. I don't mind well done, but the fact is it wasn't what I ordered. The best day to come is Whiskey Wednesday. Every Wednesday, their whiskey half off depending on the type of whiskey and it's by far their best selling point. The wait staff is great and attentive. Just stick to the whiskey, salads, and curds.

Like the ambience and the unique takes on basic bar food. The cheese curds are a great variation on fried mozzarella sticks. The sliders are fun and tasty with a nice selection for all palettes. Soups, salads and sandwiches are all good too. Not what you would expect in a college town. No pennants on the wall and pizza on the menu. Liked the decor and the service too. Street parking wasn't a problem on a Monday.  I'll be back.

Pretty good.  Definitely had a lot of slider choices.  I arrived late to a group, so I have to base my review just on the two sliders I ordered.  I got a classic with cheese and a California turkey slider.  Classic was very tasty - but then you shouldn't mess up what it a classic.  And other slider places have done as well as this one was.  California turkey was good for what it was, but turkey burger leaves a bit to be desired.  Not Seven Saints' fault, but don't put something on the menu that isn't going to be really good.
Good atmosphere , just a sandwich place. I guess they're known for their drinks. Not much variety but I loved my Ribeye Sandwich and platter !

We had dinner here during my sons college trip. The food was excellent and a great value. Coming from Boston, we were blown away by the reasonable prices. Loved the selection of craft beers. Ambiance and decor was also beautiful.

I graduated from U of I 8 years ago and to this day I still think about how good Seven Saints is-so naturally when I came back for a visit this was first of my list to stop for lunch! The atmosphere is cozy with long, elegant curtains surrounding the entrance as you walk in and we didn't have to wait even though it was lunch time. Call me a child, but my favorite thing to order here is the grilled cheese-but it's honestly the best grilled cheese I've yet to come across. It's pretty large with cheddar and provolone on sourdough bread. So cheesy, so heavenly. It comes with a side and I got the waffle fries, which are perfectly crispy and so yummy too. I also got a cup of the tomato soup (when you order grilled cheese, you need tomato soup) - that was amazing as well.  There are tons of options to pick from on the menu and also lots of options to mix and match (1/2 sandwich + soup etc). Our food came out lightening fast and had friendly service. Next time I'm back in Champaign, I'll be back for sure.

Lots of people love this place, but I've always left feeling underwhelmed. Their food doesn't taste much different than what one could get at a chain restaurant. I've been here twice. The first time I had a slider with waffle fries. The bread was a little too sweet for my taste and the burger was well cooked, but didn't seem to have been spiced well. The waffle fries tasted like something I could get at any greasy spoon.   The second time around, I had some of the famous cheese curds and a small salad. The cheese curds tasted like something I could get at applebees and I thought the crust was too sweet. The salad was fine, but   Also, the noise level is pretty high here. I'm not sure if it's less loud outside, but in the back dining room I had to nearly scream for my friend next to me to hear me.  I will say the service was excellent and they were clearly trying to keep their customers happy.  Overall, not worth the cost, I think.
Atmosphere, long velvet drapes, high backed wooden booths, staff that knows their stuff, great brew menu, well located near parking and transit.

Waitress was awesome! Joyful and talkative! She took care of our group of 9! Food was phenomenal and the crumb Burle Nutella cheesecake was mouth watering! Highly recommend the typical slider, goat cheese salad and sweet potato fries! Their hummus is homemade and was one of the best I've tasted!
Man, every time I've gone to this place, the food looks a lot better than it tastes. I've found all the food to be incredibly bland. Disappointing because the atmosphere is pretty cool.
I really enjoyed the chicken flautas here, absolutely delicious. I also had the flower power drink but it wasn't as good as I expected. Neat place!

While traveling I often eat at pubs and Seven Saints is on the high end of the list for good pub grub. I was told they were famous for their sliders, so I chose the Chicago Dog slider, mainly because I love Chicago Dogs and also because it was out of the ordinary. The slider was very good, but a little overpriced. Not wanting to fill up on just sliders, I also got the Chipotle salad which was very well done and was tasty and surprisingly filling for a salad.   I enjoyed the atmosphere- relaxed with good music playing. The waiter was friendly, but not very attentive, especially considering it was not that busy. I had to ask several times just to get a refill on my water. I often judge a place by asking myself if I would go back again.  For Seven Saints, the answer would be yes, if I happened to be in the area, but I wouldn't go way out of my way to get there.

Food and atmosphere of Seven Saints is great. They have great combo deals and the price you are paying for the quality of the food is cheap in my opinion!   Only complaint is that I once had a waitress that seemed unhappy to serving my table for no valid reason what so ever... We generously tipped her over 20% even though she wasn't very friendly or welcoming. Also had a young hostess seat us at a shabby table between the exit and kitchen once which was off putting considering there were other tables open... However overall a good place if you're looking for some good food!

As many others have said the cheese curds are amazing here. The menu has a good variety of different sliders and I would have loved to try more but those cheese curds were just too filling. The sweet potato fries are also very good and crinkle cut which was a pleasant surprise.   The service was so so and is the reason it's only 3 stars instead of 4. Our waitress seemed like she always had something more important to take care of and was slow on some basic requests.   Overall a good experience and am looking forward to another visit

Out of towners,.went downtown,found this place word of mouth..nice place,old,i had 2 sliders and potato soup fries,,awesome soup out of this world,my lady had steak sandwich also good,her bloddy mary awesome she said,my draft beer ice cold,waiter on the ball,we will go here again.

This is my go to place in town. Now that I've moved out of town I know it will be one of my go to places when I visit friends.   The sliders are great. I always go for the California Turkey Slide because of the avocado, bacon and roasted red pepper. Add Sweet potato fries and you've got a winner.   Most people get the SSS which is a combination of 3 of the following: soup, salad, slider, side.  The cheese curds here are good according to friends. I think they have a good beer selection too. Great for groups and one-on-one time. Excellent service.  Tip: they always have tomato soup and chili. Ask for their soup of the day. There's always something different!

Normally I am not one for ordering salads at restaurants but I really enjoy the salads here! My favorite is their salmon salad. I really enjoy their sliders and the pisco sour drinks here as well. The waiters and waitresses here are very friendly.

The note I left to myself after the first time I went here was: Sliders and weird salads- melted cheese.  To you all, that should mean "They are known for sliders.  My salad was slathered in melted cheese, which I found odd."  I'm not a midwesterner, so pardon my ignorance, but is this a thing?  The good thing is that a slider and a salad is a reasonable lunch.  This is also a good place to take vegetarians because they will substitute a MorningStar veggie burger on any of their sliders.  It may not be a good place for a vegan.  People I would take here:  my BFs parents, who like simple, safe food that looks familiar and is served in an establishment that seems clean.  Road weary visitors who want to walk, eat, sleep, return to road.  Westward, ho!

The selection of food here was fantastic. The drink menu was also enormous; I felt as if I could go there repeatedly and never tire of the options.   Also, the service was wonderful. We had a really large group with a set of complicated payment divisions and they handled it with remarkable patience!

I love coming here for Whiskey Wednesdays. Every week they pick a category of whiskey to be half-off. They have a great selection and usually some off-menu specials. They really know their whiskey so this is a great place to try something new of you have discriminating taste. This is possibly my favorite feature of any bar in the area.  They always have a nice selection of beer on tap too (at a nice range of prices) and have recently started "Brewsdays" with some nice beer specials.  Seven Saints has some quality food too. Sliders, salads, sides, desserts... It's all delicious. Definitely try the sweet potato fries or beet chips. My only complaint about the menu is that, since I tend to order vegetarian, the options can get a little stale (though you can sub in a veggie burger on any of their sliders).  My favorite meal? California Turkey Slider (sub a veggie burger, hold the bacon), waffle fries, and the Southwest Chipotle Salad.  And last, but not least, the atmosphere: Seven Saints feels classy, but not so classy that you'll feel underdressed if you show up in a t0shirt and jeans. It's a darker feel and the furniture and decorations are detailed and thought-out. Even when it's busy, they bar doesn't get too terribly loud so it's great for a date or a night out with friends if you'd like to be able to have a conversation at the table.

I ate there once last week the lady said oh we have a speacial im like ok she came back with the recipt it said 50 dollars im like wtf...was the Speacial....it taste it good steack potatoes but shit....aint nothing speacial....

I am from Champaign, raised there until the age of 20, when I escaped to Austin. I still go back every year for Christmas to visit family and friends, and when I do, Seven Saints is a must-hit place for food. And I get the same thing every single time.  The Triple S Combo Platter. One salmon slider. BLT salad (although I have also tried the Country Fried Chicken Salad... sounds weird but was really tasty). And the tomato basil soup.   This is a trifecta of yumminess in my tumminess.   There has only been once when the food all tasted kind of off, possibly a bad day. But every year, it always pleases me. And the bill isn't so bad. I don't really drink here, but have had a mojito that was alright, nothing special.   I will continue frequenting this establishment for my yearly Christmas visiting. Please stay in business Seven Saints, otherwise I will be forced to make this food on my own and it won't be pretty.
This is a wonderful place.  Salads are fantastic.  Mostly a slider/salad/sandwich place.    Excellent decor.  Staff is grand.  Always great!

The sweet potato chips with goat cheese cream sauce are a-MAZ-ing. This appetizer is certainly big enough to share with 1-3 other people, depending on how much other food you order. Or you could eat half yourself and take the other half home for lunch the next day. Not that I know anyone who has ever done that...

Recently went back to Champaign (where I went to grad school) for a wedding and got to hit all my old spots.  Seven Saints, per usual, did not disappoint.  Cheese curds aren't as good as they once were, but still a hit.  I always get the Triple S combo, with a salad, soup, and slider.  Black and blue salad remains one of my favorites.  Had a bad beer, but the waitress was awesome and took it off the bill, so no deductions on stars there.  If you're in town for any reason, make sure to swing by.

Service is ok to good. But the food is very good! I can't think of one bad thing here.  Sliders - Goood. Salads - Gooood.  Soups - Goooood.  (haven't had any of the sandwiches).  I recommend the combo so you get to try a few things. Favorite appetizer is the pretzels, then sweet chips, then cheese curds.  Hummus is pretty good but nothing spectacular.

I came here for Whiskey Wednesday, which is 50% off select whiskey flavors. If you don't know what that is, then you have to make sure you check out ALL of the discount alcohol nights at Seven Saints because they are all deals you should take advantage of!  The whiskey I got was Snake River Stampede. Mainly because I thought it was funny that it was considered a "rodeo whiskey" and also that the description for it said "this whisky can still kick like a bucking bronco when served neat." haha.  Another nice thing is that they alcohol menu has two featured House drinks and a description for both. This makes it a bit easier while choosing a drink and you don't have to ask the waitress/waiter about every single drink. Even though my server was nice enough to do it if asked.  I got the Triple "S" Platter (Slider, 1/2 Salad, and a Side). I got the cheese slider, 1/2 Caesar salad and waffle fries. I liked all the food. Their waffle fries were really good.  Up until I tried Seven Saints, I only thought of sliders as the little burgers you get from White Castle, but Seven Saints is now my favorite place to get them. I'll definitely be back soon.

Soooo ordered a half salad half sandwich Meal for $10.00 and my sandwich "club sandwich" was literally two pieces of lunch meat (do not ever order! Sooooo not worth the money) And the salad was ok but the chicken was wayyy over cooked and cold and dried out. Yuck. On a better note the cheese curds are AWESOME! Just never order the club. Rip off.

Probably one of my favorite bars or food places in Champaign. It's super relaxed and welcoming, and the waiters are super nice (not to mention good looking.) Always very prompt service, clean interior and bathrooms and great food.  The friend cheese curds are something I crave far too often. They come with a great marinara sauce and are super hot and chewy. My mouth waters just thinking about them.  The fish tacos and crab cakes are also delicious. Fish tacos are my budget friendly go to. Super filling and delicious.   Their soups, especially the tomato bisque are to die for as well. So flavorful.   The sliders are great too, my favorite is the salmon, but I would definitely try all of them including the buffalo chicken slider.  Whisky selection as others have said is crazy good. Definitely a must visit.

Place was slammed when I first came by so I went to a couple other places first.  Then found my way back to Seven Saints. The beer was cold and the sliders awesome. I had the  brautwerst slider and it was way different than I expected. It was great. The bartender 055 (they only have a number. No name on their tag) was great and easy to engage conversation with.  I will definitely be back next time I'm in town
One of our favorite places in Champaign. Great service, excellent food. Cheese curds!!!

I like this place when I'm in the mood for half a sandwich and salad. I normally get their Portobello sandwich or grilled cheese with the goat cheese salad. Their white chili is great when they have it. Also, I love their specials. Their drink lists are pretty nice as well.

This restaurant/bar is conveniently located in downtown Champaign. We sat down around 6PM on a Sunday Night for dinner.  Appetizer: Get the half order of pretzels. I believe this is a new menu item which comes with 2 giant soft pretzels, mustard for dipping, and an amazing jalepeno cheese sauce. The pretzel was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of salt. I could have eaten a bowl of that jalepeno cheese sauce.  Main course: I love it when restaurants allow you to combine menu items, like any variety of a soup/ salad/ sandwich combo. At SS, you can definitely create a combo to your liking. I ordered the soup with half sandwich. The price and quality just blew my mind. You think a tomato bisque soup is boring? Seven Saints will change that opinion of yours! I got that tomato bisque soup with half a tuna melt sandwich and i was in food heaven.  Dessert: It's very rare that I have room in my stomach for an appetizer, main course, and dessert. Well, I didn't have room, but that didn't stop me from ordering a sweet sensation. The blueberry cheesecake with ginger crust was absolutely incredible, and I don't regret that decision one bit.  Service: Impeccable. I ordered an arnold palmer to drink, and I never saw the bottom of my glass. The food was prompt and our server was helpful. Even with the packers vikings game on TV, we had an extremely pleasant time.  I know Illinois is known for good food, but man, I was not expecting this amazingness :) A++++++

Been years since I have been here..  Finally headed back and wasn't impressed with the fact their entire menu is fried.  Well with the exception of the hummus and sliders.  They got rid of their cheese curds.  :(  Their Manhattans are good though...  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- It seems like a Guido's wannabe meaning.. the decor is nice and could be posh.  Not so many people frequent there unfortunately.  So it's not a trendy place as of now.  It's an okay place.. I don't really like any of their specialty drinks.  I tried the Jamiebull (not enough Redbull or Jameson) and the Lemon Shakeup (too sweet).  I have tried their sliders (which is like a mini burger).. they are decent but they aren't terribly big and kind of pricey if you get three of them (which is equivalent to one burger).  I haven't had any outstanding salads here either unfortunately.  I would try it if you want a change in scenery from Guido's and Boltini's.

I think this place is great; the drink selection is substantial, the food is very unique and very good, the service is on point, the atmosphere is a bit noisy but easy to deal with and the prices are comparable to other pubs in the area. Overall, a great place to come to for good food and great beer, especially on the weekends.

This place has so much potential, so it's kind of sad that they don't have better service....   My fiance and I waited at the bar for a drink for about 15 minutes before anyone asked us what we wanted. That may not sound too long, but the place wasn't even busy. And what's funny is the bartender was like purposely ignoring us. There's no way she didn't see us politely flagging her down. She had a soft drink that she was drinking, and she stopped right in front of us, took a nice looooong drink... kind of relaxing, then she looked past us out the window, and proceeded to ignore us a bit longer. And its not like we were just standing there, you can try and flag them down, but they just ignore you like alien possessed humans staring into space or something.   The bartender finally asked what we wanted, but by then we were being seated so we said nevermind. Then we proceeded to have terrible service at our table, to the point that it was just kind of amusing. Oh and my cobb salad had these huge mushroom tentacle things that made me gag and we just sorta wiggled them at our friends like "look at this huge sick thing that's in my salad!" And the sliders are way over priced. The cheese curds were good, but a little heavy.   I say the place has potential because it's a really nice location and the inside has a nice ambiance. There is also an extensive beer list, but none of that really matters if your service is that bad...

Friends dragged me back here and I was hesitant but the service was a COMPLETE 180 from my horrible birthday dinner. Our server (Molly? short curly hair..) was probably one of the best server's I've ever had. Great menu suggestions, friendly personality, food came to the table hot, and she made sure to take care of all the little things (extra napkins, dessert being offered). Because of her I definitely will be back. Seems like the first bad experience was just the server, not the establishment.

Upscale bar experience. Food is more refined compared to places like their neighbor, Esquire. The sliders are tasty, and I have not been disappointed with anything I've ordered (soup, salad, appetizers). Its true that Seven Saints is more expensive than a dive bar, but its not a dive bar, so the prices make sense.   Service varies. Sometimes its great, other times not so much. However, it hasn't been bad enough to prevent me from returning.   Great downtown spot.

Great late not spot or really anytime of the day. The food is cheap and delicious, and the service is pretty good as well. Pretty busy on the weekends but the wait is not anything crazy. Overall one of the best restaurants in champaign.

Another solid choice for lunch and dinner casual dining. I'm usually here for business lunches but it's also served well to grab a late meal. It has a quintessential American pub menu. I like the California turkey and the little tacos. Food is moderately priced and done right. Just another great little place on the downtown Champaign scene.

I really enjoyed their little slider, soup, and sweet potato fries meal. I had their cheddar broccoli soup and it was very tasty. Also had their Blackjack Jalepeno Slider. Very good! Not atmosphere and decor. Our visits were not very frequent so that was a struggle when we needed something but otherwise it was great. Definitely recommend!

I've been here a few times for lunches with people from work, and generally we have had good experiences.  The food is pretty good quality, but the prices are just slightly above where they should be (in my opinion) since most of the items I've tried have been sliders.   My favorites are the Black Jack slider (pepperjack cheese, grilled onions and ancho aioli topped with fried jalapeños) and the Smokey BBQ slider (cheddar, bbq sauce, fried onion ring).  Good stuff.   The lunch combos are a pretty good deal, which offsets the price issue I mentioned earlier.  I usually get the slider + side + salad combo for lunch (which is about $10), and they have other combinations for that.  I've only had the Caesar salad, and it was fine.  Several of my co-workers have had the salmon slider and said it was good as well.  I have tried the crinkle-cut sweet potato fries, which were good but not my personal favorite.  The cheese curds are great (as many others have posted), but you do feel a bit of guilt for eating batter-covered balls of cheese.  It's nearly the epitome of gluttony, and you can feel your arteries harden mid-bite.  We did order the Bavarian Pretzels once also and those were good.  Service is usually average, at best, but not worth complaining about much.  If it's cold outside, avoid the table near the door!   We went once in February when it was still pretty cold out, and even with a large curtain around the entrance way, we were constantly blasted by cold air when people came in the door.  Even in warm weather it's rather distracting.  We've been seated there twice (maybe it's their only pre-setup table for 8).  I'd recommend asking to sit somewhere away from the door if possible.  We'll probably go back.  They have enough variety that it's a nice place to go occasionally.

(?^?)? Such a letdown. I'm not sure if I set expectations too high or I just went in on an off day, but this place was not as dazzlingly amazing as I thought it would be.  Waiting for a server was to come greet us took 15 minutes and getting the food had about a 30 minute wait. When it finally arrived, the food was missing about 1/4 of its supposed components listed on the menu, which sucked. I couldn't even attempt to take an appealing picture of the food (sliders) as it looked so bare and sad.  Seven Saints is quite overhyped and has mediocre food, but despite that I can't deny that they had good staff.
Amazing atmospheres casual dining and excellent food. If you come to Champaign stop here. Great food across the board and unbelievable liquor selection. Service is very friendly.
Best place downtown! Salmon slider is to do die for. Love the tuna salad platter as well. Never had an appetizer I didn't like from there. Best desserts in town! Love that drunken pie! Yum

Had dinner here with a few co workers and we saw the Yelp reviews so we decided to check it out. Beer selection was pretty decent, the main attraction here are the sliders. I will say, I had the tomato bisque soup to start and it was VERY good. I also followed up with the California slider and the turkey bacon slider. Both were OK, next time I will just stick with the beef sliders.

I've been wanting to go here since I moved to Illinois since I have heard a lot of good things about it.  Finally my co-workers decided to make this the weekly spot to go out to eat, so I was more than happy to tag along.    We went around 12 noon, on a weekday.  The inside is pretty cozy and nicely decorated.  It's almost imperial looking with the large hanging drapes as curtains.  We had a large group of 10, and fortunately we were able to get a table.  The place itself seems very large, as there were from what I could tell, 3 distinct areas to sit in, and an outside dining area as well.  All and all though, the place came across as very average to me once everything was said and done.   Granted the restaurant was pretty busy, it took our server literally 15 minutes to come get our order, and another 15 to just get our drinks (and most of us just had water).  The food did not take too long to come out, but once again I wasn't impressed at all.  I got the club sandwich with waffle fries, and I can't say it was bad at all, but there was just not a thing special about it.  It's your typical greasy fare typee of place too...
